value.title: How to Create Power BI TOP N Report (Power BI Top 10 / Top N Filter)
value.excerpt: Let me show you how you can create a Power BI TOP N Report , using a Top 10 or Top N Filter. As a bonus we will also compare this with another approach using the DAX TOPN Function. 👉 Download Power BI File in Video at https://web.learnpowerbi.com/download/  This is part of our complete TOP N playlist

value.title: Get data with Power BI Desktop
value.excerpt: How can you find, collect, and clean data from different sources? Power BI is a tool for making sense of your data. You will learn tricks to make data-gathering easier.

value.title: Avoid refresh errors when importing files in Power BI
value.excerpt: Have you refreshed Power BI files and got errors due to missing columns or unwanted columns? Here I show you how to avoid new columns for getting added and refresh error from missing columns.  I learnt this by watching Microsoft Power BI webinar with Chris Webb: https://info.microsoft.com/CO-PowerBI-WBNR-FY16-06Jun-21-Amazing-Things-with-Power-BI-Registration.html?Is=Website

value.title: Concatenate/ Merge columns with Power Query, the right way.
value.excerpt: Concatenating columns in Power Query is not hard to do, but depending on the technique you use, you might get unexpected or wrong results.  There is a bullet proof way to do it and I will explain it here.  Link to the null, blank video mentioned in this video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EoRjNx1G2g4

value.title: DAX Fridays! #78: When should I use FILTER() with CALCULATE?
value.excerpt: When should you use the filter function with CALCULATE?  As you probably have noticed, sometimes people use a column in the filter part of CALCULATE and sometimes they use the FILTER function.  The question is, when should you use what?  In this video I will try to clarify that question.  Dont miss part

value.title: Enable QUERY FOLDING for native queries in Power Query / Power BI
